column4: hey, is there a ubuntu with the 2.6.1.8 kernel already compiled and useable?
hey, is there a ubuntu with the 2.6.1.8 kernel already compiled and useable?
if you mean 2.6.18, no.
and there is no Ubuntu release with 2.6.1.
i thought someone said the nightly worked for the jmicron sata controller
meaning a snap of 2.6.19?
meaning something that will work with my stat controller
sata*
I need specifics.
like my sata controller?
no, like the kernel you're referring to
the kernel im referring to is 2.6.18 which has support for my sata controller
we don't -- at all -- ship 2.6.18.
someone said some nightly had it
then either point me to this mysterious nightly, or give me a reference to whom

im looking for the nightly myself. it was on some random forum i found on google. two other distributions ive tried that has 2.6.18 run, but wont install due to not finding disks or my harddrive isnt seen.
i use the asus p5b deluxe wifi ap ed
for my mobo
there seems to be a communication breakdown. We don't ship a 2.6.18 at all. There's 6.10's 2.6.17 or 7.04's 2.6.19.
oh, i understand, well i just want any kernel that supports my sata controller or allows me to install, im assuming 2.8.19 will?
you're free to compile your own 2.6.19-rc
thats the thing, i cant get linux on my system
thats why i need a linux installer that runs 2.6.18+ so my hardware is detected
